cats do sleep an extraordinary amount I
remember one time I was on a reporting
assignment in Africa looking at these
amazing African lions and I said to the
scientists how wonderful it is that you
get to study these animal from all day
and you said actually they're the most
boring things in the world because they
just sleep and they don't move and I
thought that's just like my cat I think
that has something to do with the way
that cats hunts they're not animals that
are moving around all day grazing out
the landscape they can kill things that
are even bigger than they are and
they're not predators that chase their
prey over long distances they hide and
wait in places like you know crannies of
boulders or moving boxes in the case of
our has cast at home and then they
pounce on things and then they get the
meat that they need and then they just
kind of rest for the day
I do think an exception to the lazy cat
rule is kittens we see and kittens
almost like a different kind of animal
incredibly active and that's because
these kittens are actually learning how
to hunt by the time they're a year old
they've already got it covered
they're already killing machines there
are sort of masters of the hunt and they
can rest because they're so good at
doing what they do
